description.narrative:
... continued from activities ...
> To assist the Government and the local authorities to revitalize primary health care facilities and services in the affected areas to mitigate the impact on health of the earthquake and to ensure continuity of pre-existing program/services including reproductive health services.
> Mobilization of multidisciplinary health experts especially from the neighbouring countries to advice on early rehabilitation of health sector. This also includes logistic support (transportation, communications, etc.), supporting health authorities in setting up of health coordination centres in a least three location, and organizing response in critical areas of public health. Development and dissemination of information kits on the disaster response.
> Setting up of information system (using LSS/SUMA). Includes mobilization of experts and setting up of information centre in point of entry and in coordination centres.
